diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,47 @@

+# ==============================================================================
+include (ExternalProject)
+
+set(snappy_URL https://github.com/google/snappy.git)
+set(snappy_TAG "1.1.6")
+set(snappy_BUILD ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/snappy/src/snappy)
+set(snappy_INCLUDE_DIR ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/snappy/src/snappy)
+
+if(WIN32)
+    set(snappy_STATIC_LIBRARIES ${snappy_BUILD}/$(Configuration)/snappy.lib)
+endif()
body: If you set `BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF` in the Snappy CMake build, does it not build static libraries? For distributing binaries, we'd strongly prefer a static library, because otherwise you end up with a further source of DLL path hell (see for example the failing Windows tests, which I'd guess are failing because they can't find the Snappy DLL).
body_html: If you set BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF in the Snappy CMake build, does it not build static libraries? For distributing binaries, we'd strongly prefer a static library, because otherwise you end up with a further source of DLL path hell (see for example the failing Windows tests, which I'd guess are failing because they can't find the Snappy DLL).
body_text: If you set BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF in the Snappy CMake build, does it not build static libraries? For distributing binaries, we'd strongly prefer a static library, because otherwise you end up with a further source of DLL path hell (see for example the failing Windows tests, which I'd guess are failing because they can't find the Snappy DLL).
